name: Desk Mess
description:
Desk Mess, a game where you play on my own desk that's alive with messy wires. Playing as Silco Bean, a small stuffed animal that keeps tabs on me while I code, you need to collect different ideas from outer mice islands while also swiping away the different evil beans that spawn and the dust that tries making it's way toward my main computer of a Raspberry Pi 400 (this game wasn't made on it sadly, Unity barely even runs on this Windows 11 laptop). The enemies slowly get faster as well (displayed on an Amazon Kindle you can climb), but you can remedy this by occasionally reminiscing in my older times when I used a Raspberry Pi 3b positioned at the right side higher layer of my desk. No win condition, just try and get a high score!

Move with WASD, Jump/Climb with space (longer hold equals higher jump), left click to swipe attack

Slider on right side of title screen is mouse sensitivity adjustment

WebGL or the play button at the top is most recommended as it's convenient and I got it working fine other than not being able to go into fullscreen mode, but a Windows and untested Mac build is available for download as well
